segment.source: The Compatibility Administrator tool helps you resolve potential application-compatibility issues before deploying a new version of Windows to your organization.
segment.target: The Compatibility Administrator tool helps you resolve potential application-compatibility issues before deploying a new version of Windows to your organization.

segment.source: Compatibility fixes, compatibility modes, and AppHelp messages that you can use to resolve specific compatibility issues.
segment.target: Compatibility fixes, compatibility modes, and AppHelp messages that you can use to resolve specific compatibility issues.

segment.source: Tools for creating customized compatibility fixes, compatibility modes, AppHelp messages, and compatibility databases.
segment.target: Tools for creating customized compatibility fixes, compatibility modes, AppHelp messages, and compatibility databases.

segment.source: A query tool that you can use to search for installed compatibility fixes on your local computers.
segment.target: A query tool that you can use to search for installed compatibility fixes on your local computers.

segment.source: The following flowchart shows the steps for using the Compatibility Administrator tool to create your compatibility fixes, compatibility modes, and AppHelp messages.
segment.target: The following flowchart shows the steps for using the Compatibility Administrator tool to create your compatibility fixes, compatibility modes, and AppHelp messages.

segment.source: Application Compatibility Toolkit (ACT) installs a 32-bit and a 64-bit version of the Compatibility Administrator tool.
segment.target: Application Compatibility Toolkit (ACT) installs a 32-bit and a 64-bit version of the Compatibility Administrator tool.

segment.source: You must use the 32-bit version to create and work with custom databases for 32-bit applications, and the 64-bit version to create and work with custom databases for 64-bit applications.
segment.target: You must use the 32-bit version to create and work with custom databases for 32-bit applications, and the 64-bit version to create and work with custom databases for 64-bit applications.

segment.source: This section provides information about using the Compatibility Administrator tool.
segment.target: This section provides information about using the Compatibility Administrator tool.

segment.source: Managing Application-Compatibility Fixes and Custom Fix Databases
segment.target: Managing Application-Compatibility Fixes and Custom Fix Databases

segment.source: This section provides information about managing your application-compatibility fixes and custom-compatibility fix databases.
segment.target: This section provides information about managing your application-compatibility fixes and custom-compatibility fix databases.

segment.source: This section explains the reasons for using compatibility fixes and how to deploy custom-compatibility fix databases.
segment.target: This section explains the reasons for using compatibility fixes and how to deploy custom-compatibility fix databases.

segment.source: You must deploy your customized database (.sdb) files to other computers in your organization before your compatibility fixes, compatibility modes, and AppHelp messages are applied.
segment.target: You must deploy your customized database (.sdb) files to other computers in your organization before your compatibility fixes, compatibility modes, and AppHelp messages are applied.

segment.source: You can deploy your customized database files in several ways, including by using a logon script, by using Group Policy, or by performing file copy operations.
segment.target: You can deploy your customized database files in several ways, including by using a logon script, by using Group Policy, or by performing file copy operations.
